description: Stand up, bend your knees and hips to lower your body as if you were sitting in a chair, then stand up again.
Lie on your back, bend your knees, and place your hands behind your head, then lift your torso towards your knees and return to the starting position.
Support yourself on your forearms and toes, maintaining a straight line from head to heels and engaging the core muscles.
Sit in a chair, then stand up without using your arms, repeat 8 to 15 times.
Using weights, bend your elbows to lift them toward your chest, repeating 8 to 15 times.
Lift one leg backward, using a chair for support if needed, doing 8 to 15 repetitions.
Raise your knees toward your chest alternately while maintaining an upright posture, working the abdominal muscles and improving cardiovascular endurance.
Alternate raising your heels and toes while standing to strengthen the calf muscles and improve balance and ankle mobility.

exerciseName: Lateral Trunk Flexion with Leg Raise
description: Involves leaning to one side while lifting the leg on the same side, strengthening the oblique abdominal muscles and improving trunk stability and upper leg strength.
Shoulder rolls involve circular movements forward or backward to relieve tension, improve flexibility, and reduce stiffness in the shoulders, neck, and upper back.
Involves tracing a figure eight in the air with your wrist, improving wrist mobility and strength, useful for injury prevention and activities requiring wrist strength and coordination.
Involves sitting on the ground with legs bent at 90-degree angles, improving hip flexibility and pelvis mobility by alternating between the two 90-degree positions to stretch the hip muscles.
